attributes.comment:
I am opposed to the proposed fee increase for the I600/I600A, biometrics fee, and
Certificate of Citizenship. I find this increase to be discriminatory in nature. Other
pieces of identification needed to function in the US have no or little fee attached
to changing a name. But the COC has an already hefty fee attached just for a
name change. Since this document is only needed by naturalized citizens, it
would seem punative to have such a fee, much less make it higher. It does seem
that natural born citizens are treated in a more fair way. As far as the increase on
the 1600/1660A applications and the biometrics fee, this seems, too,
unnecessary and as though the government has found a cash cow to take
advantage of. This is particularly true when one considers that most inter-country
adoptions take far longer than the period for which the documents are valid. Many
applicants are having to redo the entire application...along with their attached
fees...twice already. To increase these fees works against those applicants who
are trying to bring children into their families.

Comment on FR Doc # E7-01631
attributes.title: Comment Submitted by Elizabeth A. Curry
